authors.name: Albert Einstein
authors.bio: Theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics.

authors.name: Maya Angelou
authors.bio: American poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist known for her influential works on identity and empowerment.

authors.name: Friedrich Nietzsche
authors.bio: German philosopher known for his writings on morality, culture, and the human condition.

authors.name: Steve Jobs
authors.bio: Entrepreneur, inventor, and business magnate who co-founded Apple and revolutionized consumer electronics.

authors.name: Confucius
authors.bio: Chinese philosopher and politician known for his teachings on morality, social relationships, and justice.

quotes.quote: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
quotes.description: Einstein reflects on persistence and the importance of progress.

quotes.quote: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.
quotes.description: Angelou encourages resilience and perseverance despite life’s challenges.

quotes.quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
quotes.description: A philosophical reflection about purpose and human strength.

quotes.quote: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
quotes.description: Jobs inspires individuality and the courage to follow your own path.

quotes.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
quotes.description: Ancient wisdom emphasizing patience and persistence.

quotes.quote: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.
quotes.description: Angelou reminds us that our mindset defines how we experience the world.

quotes.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
quotes.description: A call to value creativity over rigid understanding.

quotes.quote: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
quotes.description: Jobs highlights creativity and originality as leadership traits.
